zendir.connection package

Submodules

zendir.connection.credentials module

class zendir.connection.credentials.Credentials(url: str = 'https://api.nominalsys.com', port: int = 443, access: str = '')

Bases: object

The Credentials class stores the credential access to the Nominal API for making API calls to the server. This can allow for both a remote or a local server call.

access_key: str = ''

Defines the access key if it exists for the API. This is required for cloud based API calls.

copy() → Credentials

Copies the current credentials to a new instance of the credentials.

Returns:

A new instance of the credentials

Return type:

Credentials

get_session_id() → str

Returns the session ID for the current session. This is used to track

Returns:

The session ID for the current session

Return type:

str

is_local: bool = False

Defines whether the URL is a localhost one or not; used to ensure that a connection is valid.

is_valid() → bool

Checks if the credentials are valid by checking if the URL is valid and the access key is valid.

Returns:

Whether the credentials are valid

Return type:

bool

port: int = None

Defines the port for the API. If left as None, no port will be used.

set_session_id(session_id: str) → None

Sets the session ID for the current session. This is used to track the current session and to ensure that the session is valid.

Parameters:

session_id (str) – The session ID for the current session

url: str = ''

Defines the base URL for the API. If empty, it assumes that the URL is localhost.

version: str = ''

Defines the version of the API that is being used.

zendir.connection.http module

This modules assists with having some helper functions for requesting data from the API and ensuring the data is in the correct form, and handling any errors.

zendir.connection.http.delete(credentials: Credentials, path: str, data: dict = {}) → dict

Performs a DELETE request to the API with the specified path and data. This will return the JSON data from the response if the request was successful.

Parameters:

  • credentials (Credentials) – The credentials to access the API

  • path (str) – The path to the API endpoint

  • data (dict) – The data to send to the API

Returns:

The JSON data from the API response

Return type:

dict

zendir.connection.http.get(credentials: Credentials, path: str, data: dict = {}) → dict

Performs a GET request to the API with the specified path and data. This will return the JSON data from the response if the request was successful.

Parameters:

  • credentials (Credentials) – The credentials to access the API

  • path (str) – The path to the API endpoint

  • data (dict) – The data to send to the API

Returns:

The JSON data from the API response

Return type:

dict

zendir.connection.http.patch(credentials: Credentials, path: str, data: dict = {}) → dict

Performs a PATCH request to the API with the specified path and data. This will return the JSON data from the response if the request was successful.

Parameters:

  • credentials (Credentials) – The credentials to access the API

  • path (str) – The path to the API endpoint

  • data (dict) – The data to send to the API

Returns:

The JSON data from the API response

Return type:

dict

zendir.connection.http.post(credentials: Credentials, path: str, data: dict = {}) → dict

Performs a POST request to the API with the specified path and data. This will return the JSON data from the response if the request was successful.

Parameters:

  • credentials (Credentials) – The credentials to access the API

  • path (str) – The path to the API endpoint

  • data (dict) – The data to send to the API

zendir.connection.http.put(credentials: Credentials, path: str, data: dict = {}) → dict

Performs a PUT request to the API with the specified path and data. This will return the JSON data from the response if the request was successful.

Parameters:
